content: evelyn clark designs madrona lace scarf this rectangular scarf was designed to celebrate both madrona fiber arts 15th anniversary retreat in 2014 and the tree for which the conference is named like the madronas native to the pacific northwest this scarf has leaves and berries it is knit from end to end and the asymmetrical patterning includes a 10-stitch leaf repeat to customize the width an option is given to add beads between the motifs and at the symmetrically scalloped ends this design looks great in a variety of handspun and commercial lace fingering and shetland/sport/dk
